title: Pytorch is not printing "variable containing:" as it used to before
body_html:
Yesterday I upgraded my pytorch to master, and it has stopped printing the "variable containing:" tag it used to before when you print a variable. I'm attaching a snapshot of my terminal window.
Earlier it used to do

a = Variable(torch.zeros(2))
print(a)
# earlier printed
# Variable containing:
# 0
# 0
#[torch.FloatTensor of size (2,)]
body_text:
Yesterday I upgraded my pytorch to master, and it has stopped printing the "variable containing:" tag it used to before when you print a variable. I'm attaching a snapshot of my terminal window.
Earlier it used to do
a = Variable(torch.zeros(2))
print(a)
# earlier printed
# Variable containing:
# 0
# 0
#[torch.FloatTensor of size (2,)]
body: Yesterday I upgraded my pytorch to master, and it has stopped printing the "variable containing:" tag it used to before when you print a variable. I'm attaching a snapshot of my terminal window. Earlier it used to do ``` a = Variable(torch.zeros(2)) print(a) # earlier printed # Variable containing: # 0 # 0 #[torch.FloatTensor of size (2,)] ```
